Mitchell Associates Commercial

posted by Zach Phillips

We participated in a commercial competition put on by the Delaware Independent Filmmakers and the Newark Film Festival.

The contest is a pretty interesting concept, as it gives each major sponsor of the festival its own ad, which runs before each screening. The filmmakers who are competing get to put their work on the big screen and stand to win some money, the sponsors get a 30-second spot for themselves, and the festival gets a nice way to plug the sponsors.

Each filmmaker is assigned a client based on a lottery, and I was given Mitchell Associates, a pretty big interior design/architecture firm here in Wilmington.

Mitchell was awesome to work with, and I think we got a pretty nice spot out of this. Only part Iâ€™m dubious about is the voiceover, which is my first ever attempt at recording myself

The music was composed and produced in a pinch by the ever-so-talented Elizabeth Luttinger out in Los Angeles.

Also, we won. Not a big deal.

Posted Saturday, November 12
